fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using languages other than English with the Versions and Releases feature in next-gen projects causes an error when updating issue types.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen Software project
 # Go to the Features page in project settings and turn on the `Versions and Releases` feature
 # Change your language to anything other than English
 # Go to the Issue Types page in project settings.
 # Make sure a full page load happens on the issue type page by using browser refresh.
 # Make any change to an issue type and press save

h3. Expected Results

The change will be saved correctly.
h3. Actual Results

A generic error message is shown and the issue type isn't saved.
h3. Workaround
 # In the Issue Types settings page, remove the Fix Version field
 # Make all desired changes to the issue type except for adding the Fix Versions field
 # Save your changes
 # Add the Fix Versions field back to the issue type, if desired
fields.summary: Error updating next-gen issue types with Fix Versions when not using English

fields.description: Customers need to have an admin dedicated to user management and that they cant manage other features like permissions or workflows.
fields.summary: Dedicated user management Admin

fields.description: The dropdown from User Management filters are not showing the complete description, we would like the possibility to expand the dropdown columns width.
fields.summary: Dropdown from User Management filters are not showing complete description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to open a hyperlink from a comment in single-line with additional text at macOS Jira
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single-line comment in Jira with the following format: 
{code:java}
[Text][Hyperlink]{code}
 # Try to open the Hyperlink from the comment.

h3. Expected Results

That you were redirected to the browser & try to open the page from the hyperlink
h3. Actual Results

Open the Edit/Delete/Copy menu
h3. Workaround

Yo need to add two "Enters" to separate the text from the Hyperlink:

 
{code:java}
[Text] 
 
[Hyperlink]
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to open a hyperlink from a comment in single-line with additional text at macOS Jira
JQL issueLinkType is inconsistent when using != or NOT IN operators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view, When copying from a comment that contains quote syntax with single number and a dot at the beginning of the text, user can't paste it to the comment field.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From the new issue view, comment as below :-
 !Screenshot 2020-01-07 at 3.52.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, copy the text and try to paste it to comment field.

h3. Expected Results
Able to paste the text

h3. Actual Results
Unable to paste the comment text
 
h3. Note
Tested at Chrome, Firefox and IE11

h3.Workaround
* Remove the number at the beginning of the text in the quote; or
* Go to old issue view and copy in text mode (with syntax code) and paste it in text.
fields.summary: In the new issue view, unable to paste comment text when it contains quote syntax with single number and a dot in the beginning of the text

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issues shouldn't be closed as duplicate if there's no issue linked

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a post function to prevent transition if resolution is duplicate and no issue is linked

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Prevent transition if resolution is duplicate and no issue is linked

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Tickets in Service Desk next-gen projects assigned to the user are not being shown in the Your Work > Assigned to me tab

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Service Desk Next-gen project
# Create a ticket and assign to yourself
# Check the Your Work > Assigned to me tab

h3. Expected Results
The ticket is listed under the Your work > Assigned to me tab

h3. Actual Results
No tickets are shown in the Your work > Assigned to me tab

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Service Desk, Next-gen and Classic issues are not showing under the Your Work > Assigned to me tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the old issue view, a user can copy the link of a comment and use the URL to send to others and when they access it, the comment will be focused.

This is not possible in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create this ability in the new issue view

h3. Workaround 
Use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to copy link of comment in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a user, I would like to be able to display specific custom field values for each transition, similarly to the *jira.field.resolution.include* and *jira.field.resolution.exclude* properties. An example could be jira.field.customfield_XXXXX.include or exclude.
fields.summary: Allow custom fields to be used as Workflow Properties

fields.description:
For each swimlane, allow a configuration setting which can be either ON or OFF (enabled).

 

 
{code:java}
WHEN the feature is enabled,
AND WHEN there are no tickets in the kanban board with the status for that swimlane,
THEN the swimlane collapses or is hidden.

WHEN the feature is enabled,
AND WHEN there are tickets in the kanban board with the status for that swimlane,
THEN the swimlane becomes and is visible.

WHEN the feature is disabled,
THEN the swimlanes behave as they currently do (always visible regardless of being empty or not).

{code}
fields.summary: Make JIRA's Kanban Boards' Swimlanes Individually & Independently Support "Hidden When No Items Have This Status"

fields.description: We'd like to have the ability to surface the Due Date field on board cards in the Jira Software Cloud app similiar to what is possible in the web interface.
fields.summary: Show Due Date on Board Cards in Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer was unable to create Sub-Tasks due to the default assignee (the Project Leader) was deactivated. There is no error message of any type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deactivate the default assignee
 # Try to create a Sub-Task

h3. Expected Results

An error message explaining why you were unable to create the Sub-Task
h3. Actual Results

A page refresh with the Sub-Task not created.
h3. Workaround

Activate the deactivated user or change the default assignee
fields.summary: Unable to create Sub-Tasks if the default assignee is a deactivated user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the endpoint "/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog" with a value for the "startedAfter" parameter, users will have all the entries although informing a specific date to filter the worklogs out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue, and log a couple of entries, preferably with different days;
 # Specify a date and then convert to UNIX time, keep that value;
 # Run the following URL in your browser:
 #* "curl -D- -u <email>:<api-token> -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/<issue-key>/worklog?statedAfter=<unix-time>"

h3. Expected Results
Worklogs only on the specified timestamp will return.

h3. Actual Results
All worklogs will return.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "startedAfter" parameter doesn't work for the "/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog" endpoint

fields.description:
Currently, newly created issues on a board sorted by Rank are automatically ranked at the bottom of the Backlog. 

I suggest the ability for users to choose to rank newly created issues to the top of the Backlog. 

This will allow users to now need to scroll down through a large backlog to appropriately organize something that is top of mind, and may be a top priority. 

One idea could be to enable to "Rank by DESC" option, that would still allow drag-and-drop, but change the topmost issue to the most recently created issue.
fields.summary: New Issue Rank to Top

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In next-gen project, importing issues via CSV will not import data into "Paragraph" field.

h3. Environment
* Next-gen project
* CSV Importer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a simple CSV file
{code}
Summary,Paragraph
Test,Text in Paragraph field
{code}
# Create a custom field of type "Paragraph" in next-gen project in one of the issue types
# Import the CSV file into next-gen project using *"External System Import"*
# Issue imported successfully

h3. Expected Results
"Paragraph" type field is populated with data in CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
"Paragraph" type field is empty.

h3. Workaround
# Use *"Import issues from CSV"* from Issue Navigator, https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/issues

or

# Create a classic project
# Create custom field type "Text (Multi-line)"
# Add custom field in screens used in the classic project
# Import CSV file into classic project

h3. Note
Even moving issue from classic project to next-gen project does not allow to copy the data into "Paragraph" field.
fields.summary: Next-gen CSV Import - cannot import data into "Paragraph" field

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, to search for the URL custom field we can use =, !=, is not, is, not in and in.
h3. Suggestion

It would be great if we could use CONTAINS in order to find, for example, all URLs that has .com, .org, .net and so on.
fields.summary: Ability to use CONTAINS ~ for the URL custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The API /rest/api/3/auditing/record will return the username of the users mentioned on logs but [usernames are being deprecated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the API /rest/api/3/auditing/record

h3. Expected Results
The Atlassian Account ID is returned by the API.

h3. Actual Results
Usernames are listed.

h3. Workaround
Not available
fields.summary: Audit Logs API should return Atlassian Account ID instead of username

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per summary, custom multi line fields are not rendering URLs as hyper links in new JIRA issue view. System field like description still render URL fine.

In old JIRA issue view, URLs in old JIRA issue view are rendered as hyper links.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi line custom field.
 # Insert it into a screen of a project.
 # Fill in any URLs into it.

h3. Expected Results

URLs should automatically be rendered as hyper links.

!image-2020-01-03-13-53-54-856.png|thumbnail!

The screenshot above is from the old JIRA issue view.
h3. Actual Results

URLs are rendered as plain text.

!image-2020-01-03-13-53-23-080.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Set Wiki Style as Renderer in *Project Settings > Fields* for the affected field. Once Wiki Style is used, the URL is correctly rendered as expected.
fields.summary: Multi line fields are not rendering URLs as hyper links automatically in new JIRA issue view

fields.description: quite simply, being red-green colorblind, it's impossible for me to tell between `Major` and `Critical` priority levels by looking at the backlog list's icons, notably slowing my productivity while using this software. A quick fix would be to either change the colors to be colorblind friendly, or allow for customization of colors or icons.
fields.summary: Make Priority Icon Customizable To Support Colorblind Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When we disable notifications on our profile, it disables email notifications and also notifications on the "Watching" tab on the sidebar.
h3. Suggestion

Show notifications on the Watching tab even if the email notifications are disabled.
fields.summary: Show "Browser" notifications for watched issues even if notifications are disabled

fields.description:
In the Jira people section, it shows people the current logged in user has "works with". This is good for tracking historical interaction. However, when a user has already been deleted from a site, it should no longer show as works with.

h1. Proposed Solution 1: 
Remove the user entirely from the works with history

h1. Proposed Solution 2: 
Put the removed user in a section with different wordings like "Worked with" (not "Works with")
fields.summary: Remove/Change deleted user from "Works with"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

:check_mark: markdown is not working when it is copy-pasted in a new issue view. However, if you type the markdown the emoji selection combo is coming.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a new bug in a scrum project in a new issue view.
 2. Copy-paste or type in :check_mark: markdown in the description field. The emoji combo is not coming.
 3. Edit the bug issue. 
 4. When you type in :check_mark: markdown emoji combo is coming. However, if you copy-paste the markdown, the emoji combo is not coming.
h3. Expected Results

When you create a bug issue, the description field should show emoji combo even if the user types or copy-paste a markdown. The same behaviour should be there when the issue is edited also.

 
h3. Actual Results

During bug issue creation, the description field does not show emoji combo even if the user types or copy-paste a markdown. However during edit after issue creation, the emoji combo comes only if the user types in the markdown. Copy-paste of the markdown does not work here.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

User needs to manually type in the markdown in edit mode or use tags such as (/)
fields.summary: :check_mark: markdown is not working when it is copy pasted in new issue view. However if you type the markdown the emoji selection combo is coming.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Agile Wallboard Gadget fails to render anything and also leaves no option to edit its configuration, intermittently OR few days after the gadget has been configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an Agile Wallboard Gadget in Dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget loads results as configured.

h3. Actual Results
If the problem is reproduced then the gadget fails to render and below error is thrown
 !Screenshot 2020-01-01 at 5.31.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Recreate the gadget.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget fails to load
Creating an issue inline inside an Epic where the transition has a screen will fail

fields.description:
The *Roadmap* feature on next-gen project shows Epics on a timescale view. In Jira Cloud apps for iPad and MacOS, trying to move epics in a Roadmap does not work. In order to change the order/duration of epics, the issue details must be edited and the _Start date_ / _Due date_ fields changed.

*Suggestion*:
Allow clicking/dragging actions on the Roadmap to change the dates of epics in the iPad and MacOS apps.

 

Suggested from Community: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-it-possible-to-drag-and-drop-roadmap-in-Jira-App-for-Mac/qaq-p/1257179
fields.summary: Drag and Drop in Roadmap on iPad and Mac App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We set the permissions to 'resolve' and 'close' issues only to administrators, but all users can still transition the issue status to 'resolved'.
 !image-2019-12-31-20-26-03-205.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step Edit Project permissions- Close Issues to Project roll (administrator)
 # Step Resolve Issues permissions to Project roll (administrator)
 !image-2019-12-31-20-27-22-407.png|thumbnail! 
 # Step log in as a user with any different roll(service desk customer)
 !image-2019-12-31-20-28-43-649.png|thumbnail! 
 # Step Open a Jira issue and move the issue status > To Do> In process>Done
 !image-2019-12-31-20-29-42-639.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

In this case, users without the "administrator" role should not be able to resolve the issue.
h3. Actual Results

All users without the "administrator" role are able to resolve the issue.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Remove and close issue permissions are not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever a rest api call is made for worklog, the result is returned based on the Default user timezone instead of the user timezone. This makes the returned worklog result is different from the user timezone as the result is returned based on the site default user timezone 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a rest api call to rest/api/2/issue/14033/worklog/

h3. Expected Results
The result is returned based on the user timezone.

h3. Actual Results
The results are being returned based on the default user timezone

h3. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Rest Api worklog returns result in wrong timezone

fields.description:
When using the Atlassian cloud gmail app to create issues, it is currently not possible to use the assignee of the issue while the issue is being created through Gmail.

This feature would help reduce the duplicating of effort for having to create an issue from the gmail app and then still having to login to Jira to assign the issue.
fields.summary: Atlassian gmail App set assignee during issue creation

fields.description:
When using the Atlassian cloud gmail app to create issues, it is currently not possible to use the assignee of the issue while the issue is being created through Gmail.

This feature would help reduce the duplicating of effort for having to create an issue from the gmail app and then still having to login to Jira to assign the issue.
fields.summary: Atlassian gmail App set assignee during issue creation

fields.description:
When the sprint featue is turn
When the sprint feature is turned off for team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects, the project creates a default board where issues can be moved into. The default board is available only when viewing the issues through the web. The default board is not reflected in mobile view.

Make the default board also accessible when using Jira mobile to access the project.
fields.summary: On mobile cant move issue to board when the sprint feature is turned off for team-managed (formerly next-gen) project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing the color of a Pipe, it renders incorrectly if the ticket is created via email
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email to a SD project that contains a text like This {color:#FF0000}|{color} is {color:#FF0000}|{color} a | pipe, but change the pipes' color.

h3. Expected Results

It shows the pipes correctly.

!old view.png|width=239,height=71!
h3. Actual Results

It renders incorrectly.

!new view.png|width=433,height=154!
h3. Workaround


If you are using a classic project, please disable the new issue view on your Profile picture > Jira labs.
fields.summary: When changing the color of a Pipe, it renders incorrectly if the ticket is created via email (New issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to add text formatting to an issue summary.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add text formatting option to summary field.

h3. Why this is important
Customers want to highlight the issue summary both in the issue view and in the board, specially when the board's swimlanes are based on stories and display the name of the parent issue.
fields.summary: Ability to add text formatting to issue summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Upon opening a Jira project, you should be redirected to the last page you accessed in that project. However, accessing any page other than Active Sprint or Backlog breaks this functionality.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the components/releases/etc page on a project
 # Open the project on another tab and it won't open the components/releases/etc page

h3. Expected Results

You're redirected to the page you last visited
h3. Actual Results

You're actually redirected to Active Sprint / Backlog (Software projects), Board (Business projects) or Open Issues for projects without boars.
fields.summary: Projects no longer redirects users to last visited page

fields.description:
As a user I should be able to expand all the epics in Next-gen roadmap, at once. If there are several epics, as of now its a tedious process to manually expand all the epics to see the child issues and export the image. Please consider adding an "expand all" button at the Epic section.

!Screen Shot 2019-12-27 at 5.56.57 PM.png|width=500,height=200!
fields.summary: Allow the ability to expand all epics at once in Next-gen Roadmap

fields.description:
Suggestion - 
As a customer, we would want an email notification when an issue is flagged.

When an issue is flagged, there should be an option to customize notification in a way that it should notify a set of customers whom we want to send an alert to.

Currently, the generic event will not solve the purpose as no workflow transition is done.
fields.summary: Notification for a specific set of users when an issue is flagged

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the bulk change feature from the Jira / Search window will pick up the wrong query result, if between running the query and invoking the bulk change feature another query is run even if that query is run in a different browser.
   
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browser A: Open first browser - In my case Firefox
# Browser A: Open second browser - In my case Chrome
# Browser A: Navigate to https://hello.atlassian.net/issues and run a query - In my case {{parent in (AAAF-4)}}
# Browser A: Wait until result is displayed
# Browser B: Navigate to https://hello.atlassian.net/issues and run a different query - In my case {{parent in (AAAF-453)}}
# Browser B: Wait until result is displayed
# Browser A: Select "Bulk Change all x issues"

h3. Expected Results
The Bulk operation wizard will show a list of issues to chose from. The list is the one queried in the browser used - browser A.

h3. Actual Results
The Bulk operation wizard will show a list of issues to chose from. The list is the one queried in browser B.

h3. Workaround
Do not use a search window in any window / browser with the same user account.
fields.summary: Bulk change pickes up query result from wrong session

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

Currently, it's not possible to save all attachments on the mobile app. It's necessary to open the attachment and then download it.

By default, the attachment is saved on the "Downloads" folder.
h3.  Suggestion:

Add an option to download all attachments (the same as we have on the old issue view) and if possible, an option to save to an existing folder or create a new one.
fields.summary: Ability to download all attachments and select the folder when using Jira Cloud App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the PDF attachment was uploaded using new issue view, it cannot be viewed in mobile app. The same PDF attachment can be viewed in the app if it were uploaded using the old issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a PDF attachment to an issue using new issue view
# View the issue using mobile app and click on the PDF attachment

h3. Expected Results
The PDF attachment is being previewed.

h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Upload PDF attachments using old issue view.
fields.summary: Cannot view PDF attachments in mobile app if they were uploaded using new issue view

fields.description: Ability to show Checklist by default without having to click on the checklist icon
fields.summary: Ability to show Checklist by default without having to click on the checklist icon

fields.description: As a Jira admin or as an end user, I'd like to have the ability to send the filter subscriptions as a CSV file instead of email or RSS formats as mentioned on this article: [Subscribing to your search results|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-search-results-765593781.html].
fields.summary: Email subscription sent as a CSV format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Bubble chart* gadget shows a relation between *Comments* and the *Days open*.

While the *Days open* attribute in the bubbles seems to be aligned with the *Days open axis*, the *Comments* attribute does not seem to be aligned with its respective axis.

See some examples:
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-24 at 08.21.52.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-12-24 at 08.21.44.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a *Bubble chart* gadget in a dashboard;
* Click on a bubble and compare its attributes with their axis alignment.

h3. Expected Results

Both attributes would be aligned with their respective axis.

h3. Actual Results

The number of comments is not aligned with its axis.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Bubble chart's number of comments atribute is not aligned with the Comments axis

fields.description:
Currently, when a custom field of checkbox type is set up in a tab in the old issue view layout, it's shown in the right-hand-side panel when the issue is displayed in the new issue view. Clicking on it loads another view where the field is shown. Clicking on the field shows the checkbox options already selected and the options available for further selection. All this information is displayed in a very compact, rather congested space where options are truncated and two scrollers are shown in very close proximity.

See:  [^custom_field_newissueview.mp4] 

The suggestion is to widen this space where these custom fields are shown.
fields.summary: widen the area where tabbed custom checkbox type field options are shown in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a table in the description of the old issue view, the table renders correctly. However, when switching to the new issue view, it breaks. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue;
 # Switch to the old issue view;
 # Create a table using, for example:
{code}||Header1||Header2||
|a|b|
|c|d|{code}
 # Switch to the new issue view;

h3. Expected Results
The table in the description will render correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The table will break its layout.

Example:
||Old issue view||New issue view||
| !Screen Shot 2019-12-23 at 16.05.37.png|thumbnail! | !Screen Shot 2019-12-23 at 16.05.49.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Create the table using the new issue view.
fields.summary: Creating table in the description using the old issue view breaks the table in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Work log is currently not showing correctly. Instead of showing 'now' or the current time stamp on work log creation, the created time of the work log is showing around 7-16 hours of difference.

This only happens in the new JIRA issue view. Previous work log entries are unaffected. Only new work log entries are showing this problem.

*Update :* It would seem that this is due to the 'Date Started' field being automatically adjusted in the new JIRA issue view when logging time. This behavior does not happen with the old JIRA issue view; only the new JIRA issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Activate new JIRA issue view.
 # Just create a work log in a JIRA issue.
 # Check the work log tab (from old issue view) or select work log from drop down (new issue view).

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Worklog should show the current time as soon as it is created.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of showing the current time, work log is showing an incorrect time. There a few hours differences.
h3. Workaround

* Revert to old JIRA issue view by disabling Atlassian Labs at https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa .
* When logging time in new JIRA issue view, ensure that the 'Date Started' field value is correct.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Worklog time stamp is being recorded and showing wrongly in new JIRA issue view

fields.description:
If a project has a long name, then the project names are truncated in the project picker drop-down. This causes confusion if multiple projects have a similar initial part of their name. E.g. the following names would appear the same in the dropdown.

* Very Very Long Project name 001
* Very Very Long Project name 002
* Very Very Long Project name 003

 !Screen Shot 2019-12-23 at 2.26.48 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The suggestion is to make the project name picker wide enough to show the full name of the project with the largest name. It should take as much maximum space allowed by the screen resolution.


h3. Workaround

* Use different icons for such projects to differentiate between them.
* Slid the cursor using keyboard/mouse to reveal the full name.
fields.summary: project names are truncated in the project picker drop-down and cause confusion if multiple projects have a similar initial part of the name.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We had the incident below raised with issues around Jira Agile Widget loading in both Jira and Confluence Cloud platforms

Jira Core : [https://jira-core.status.atlassian.com/incidents/4stsp4zkl9bf]
 JSW : [https://jira-software.status.atlassian.com/incidents/w44cbl268l7d]
 Confluence : [https://confluence.status.atlassian.com/incidents/1c2fg87c1l81] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira 
 # Load any dashboard that has Jira Agile Widgets/Gadgets

Variation to above , could be if Confluence pages call Jira Widgets as well.
h3. Expected Results

Gadget displays data as normal
h3. Actual Results
 # Error below is displayed  :

{noformat}
"This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Users can use the workaround of recreating the gadget in case issue persists. 
h3. Update 23rd December 08:50 UTC
 
Issue is now resolved - see update note at the incident pages above. 
{quote}
Between 01:30 UTC Dec 20th to 08:03 UTC Dec 23rd, we experienced issues with Agile Widgets loading at Atlassian Cloud Jira. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally. Some users may still need to refer to the workaround highlighted at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73592.
{quote}
fields.summary: Agile Widgets load with error message "Gadget cannot be displayed" on Jira Dashboards

fields.description: It would be great if we have option to use @ here or @ everyone in the slack channel so that everyone can be notified in the channel with issue creation and update.
fields.summary: Slack channel notification with @here or @everyone upon issue creation or update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When bulk moving issues from a Next-gen project to a classic one, if there are issues from the same issue type belonging to different Epics, Jira won't group those issues within the same issue type during the process. It also won't warn admin from which Epic they belong to, making the process confusing. The video below better demonstrates the problem:

 [^JRACLOUD-73590.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a Next-gen project with 2 Epics (Epic 1 and Epic 2) and 2 child issues from the same issue type, one belonging to each Epic (Task 1 belongs to Epic 1 and Task 2 belongs to Epic 2, for example);
# start the process of bulk moving all issues from the Next-gen project to another one;
# Reach the screen to select which issue goes to which project.

h3. Expected Results
Jira will either group the issue type in just a single line or will inform admins to which Epic that issue belongs to.
Given that, at this moment, the loss of Epic <> child relationship will happen in this process (of moving issues from the Next-gen project to the classic one), it would be better if Jira simply groups all issue types in a single line. According to our [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects-957974933.html]:
{quote}
*Jira moves your epics across if you map them to an epic issue type in your new project. But, you'll lose the relationship between your epics and their child issues. The child issues themselves will sill exist, but the links between them won't.*
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Jira shows multiple lines for the same issue type, making the process confuse.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround for this scenario. Despite no data will be loss, this just confuses admins.
fields.summary: Jira won't group issues from the same issue type on a bulk move, if they belong to a different Epic, on a Next-gen project

fields.description:
Gmail accounts will only allow access to accounts using OAuth early next year. Suggestion to provide OAuth support for Gmail accounts

h3. Workaround
Unless Atlassian provides the OAuth support for Gmail accounts, use the following workarounds to ensure Jira continues to process incoming email
* Enable 2FA and create the app password using document https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/185833?hl=en
* Setup automatic forwarding from your Gmail account to the project's default mail handler
fields.summary: Allow OAuth support for Gmail accounts from Jira when configuring an Incoming mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer is facing a concern where they have to manually click on the add-on button to make it appear in the new issue view. The old issue view used to display the add-ons added on to the project automatically in the issue view.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to the user to enable the add-on panel in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Ability to display the add-on panel automatically in the new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding the Created VS Resolved gadget to a dashboard, the dates displayed on graphs are not aligned when comparing the two graphs this gadget displays. 
 !Annotation 2019-12-19 091128.png|thumbnail! 

Also, if you hover over the graphs, the indication line that appears on both graphs is not aligned too.
 !Annotation 2019-12-19 092447.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Correct this alignment issue on graphs so it'll display this information in a better way to compare both graphs.
fields.summary: Created VS Revolved gadget are not aligned according to date

fields.description:
As a Jira user we shouldn't have to pay for apps based on the number of users we have in JIRA.  There are many apps in marketplace that are only conducive to either a Jira admin, Scrum master or upper management.  Why do we have to pay for licenses when only an eight of our users will be using the app. 

 

Please consider re-engineering this.
fields.summary: Paying for apps based on your JIRA licenses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Loading and editing worklog with a large number of times out and fails on the new issue view. The browser page becomes unresponsive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the user has correct permissions to view/edit worklog.
# Try to load worklog history on an issue with large number of work log entries and comments. The number of comments should be sufficiently high. Over 1000 worklog comments.

h3. Expected Results
The worklog loads and becomes editable in expected time i.e. same as other application areas.

h3. Actual Results
The worklog with a large number of comments times out and fails to load. The browser page becomes unresponsive.


h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view which works fine.
fields.summary: Loading and editing worklog with a large number of worklog comments fails on the new issue view

fields.description: Availability to Highlight/Mark text in the Description field
fields.summary: Availability to Highlight/Mark text in the Description field

fields.description: A 'Component' search filter would be great to see when searching in the Android app - currently there is only 'Type', 'Status', 'Assignee' and 'Label'. A 'Component' option would help to narrow down searches.
fields.summary: Add 'Component' search filter in the Android app

fields.description: As a user I want to a button to quickly Split tasks in backlog. Old gen Jira offers a very nice split option, which clones all the content and then I can quickly edit each task.
fields.summary: Add Split option in Jira Next Gen

fields.description: When dragging a divider between sprints, I want to see the same counter in Next Gen as I see in old Gen. Then we can clearly see what is the sum of story poins where we plan to cut off the line and it's really useful for sprint plannings
fields.summary: Auto-sum story points when dragging sprint divider

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing classic project issues and filters when you don't have Browse Project permissions throws an error 500 instead of showing a message of lack of permissions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project
 # Make your user to not have access to the project
 # Click on the project *Issues & Filters* option as a Jira Administrator

h3. Expected Results
A message of lack of permissions should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Error 500 is thrown in the screen.

h3. Workaround
Grant your user permission to the project.
fields.summary: Accessing classic project issues when you don't have Browse Project permissions throws an error 500

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user is not able to set the site language to UK English on [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings]
h3. Suggested Solution

Add *UK English* to the list of supported locales on [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings]
h3. Why this is important

The customer wants to set their language to English UK

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In "Create Issue" and "Edit Issue" screen, selecting and deselecting the checkbox for "Configure Fields - Custom" will add and remove the field, but does not change the checkbox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or Edit an issue
# Click on "Configure fields"
# Click on "Custom"
# Check and uncheck the fields
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Checkbox for selected field should be check and uncheck when clicking on it.

h3. Actual Results
Checkbox for selected field does not change.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: In "Create/Edit Issue" screen, "Configure Fields - Custom" checkbox is not responding

fields.description:
I often need to copy the title and id of a Jira issue and paste it somewhere else (Slack, Github, etc). I'd like to have a keyboard shortcut that does this for me, i.e copies the issue ID and the title as a nicely formatted string and puts it on my clipboard. Something like this:

*[PROJ-555] Fix all the things*

Thank you!
fields.summary: Shortcut for copying Issue ID + Title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While using Create Another option to create a new issue,  value for the custom field is not getting copied over. The custom field is of type - User Picker (multiple users)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a field of type User Picker (multiple users) and attach it to the project.
 # Step 2  Create an issue and enter x,y,z value in the above field but make sure to click on Create Another option as well.
# Syep 3 You will notice that the next screen for creating issues second time will not have field values copied over.

h3. Expected Results
Field values should be retained.

h3. Actual Results
Field values are not retained.

h3. Workaround
Bulk update all issues to set custom field values
Setting up a default value for the custom field.
fields.summary: While using Create Another option to create a new issue value for the custom field is not getting copied over.

fields.description: Have an option to get an export from the Audit Log screen specifying time and dates.
fields.summary: Automatic Export of Audit Logs

fields.description:
At the moment, there's only *Issue_updated* event to fire a Webhook which includes various updates of the issue.

It would be great to have an option to trigger the Webhook based a specific custom field.
fields.summary: Have an option to fire Webhook based on customfield

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If *Time Tracking* is set to *Tempo Timesheets* instead of *Jira provided time tracking*, the field *Time Tracking* should cease to appear. Instead *Original Estimate* should be only shown. However, in *New issue View* the *Time Tracking* field briefly appears before it's replaced by the the *Original Estimate* field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set *Time Tracking* to *Tempo Timesheets*
 # Ensure that the *Time Tracking* field is a part of *Context Fields* section in the *Issue layout*.
# Create an issue.

h3. Expected Results
* *Original Estimate* field appears.

h3. Actual Results
* The field *Time Tracking* appears briefly before *Original Estimate* appears.

h3. Workaround
* Move the *Time Tracking* field to the *Hidden fields* section in *Issue Layout*. 

OR

Raise a request with the Tempo Team to Initiate a Sync of Worklogs. 
This will take around 12 to 24 hours to Complete.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Field appears briefly even when time tracking provider is not Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Jira Cloud for Excel to import fields containing dates and times, the date and time format imported is incorrect.

When the language in Jira is set to English, some imported fields contain the incorrect format.

"Created" and "Updated" fields show contain format.

"Last Viewed", "[CHART] Date of First Response", and "Status Category Changed" fields contain incorrect format.

When the language in Jira is set to Polish or Danish, all fields contain the incorrect format.

The incorrect date and time format:
yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss:SSSZ

The correct date and time format: 
The one configured in Excel – Depends on locale

Example with Jira and Excel in English:

 !windows_10_pro_eng.png|thumbnail! 

Example with Jira and Excel in Polish:

 !windows_10_pro_polish.png|thumbnail! 

Example with Jira in Danish and Excel in English:

 !windows_10_pro_eng_jira_danish.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your Jira profile language to something other than English.
 # Import fields containing dates and times to Excel using the Jira Cloud for Excel app.

h3. Expected Results
Fields containing dates and times are consistently imported in a format that Excel can recognize and render correctly for the locale used in Excel.

h3. Actual Results
Fields that contain dates and times are imported inconsistently in different formats depending on the language chosen in Jira and not rendered correctly by Excel.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Importing fields with date and time in Microsoft Excel using Jira Cloud for Excel imports incorrect time and date format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Filter Counts gadget displaying multiple options to chose from the same status
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add gadget
 # Chose Filter Counts
 # Search for the status 'In Progress'
!image-2019-12-17-14-23-46-775.png|width=150,height=132!

h3. Expected Results

Display one option per status
h3. Actual Results

Multiple options (have seen it with 20+ occurrences) of the same status
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. Choosing any status will produce the same results
fields.summary: Filter Counts gadget displaying multiple options for the same status name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While trying to add a request participant in the Jira mobile android app, it fails to add and shows a network connection error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a JSD issue in the Jira mobile android app
# Try adding a request participant

h3. Expected Results
* The request participant is added successfully.

h3. Actual Results
* The request participant fails to add with network connection error.

The below error is shown.
 !81192753-a899-4d2b-86f9-a976deb93799.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding request participant on Jira mobile - Android app fails

fields.description: A [Jira|https://twitter.com/Jira] request: Allow the Scrum Master role (or permission set) to hide Sprint buckets and other Planning artifacts. Planning for PI Planning involves work in the Backlog the team doesn’t need to be distracted with.
fields.summary: Allow scrum master or admins to hide sprint buckets, etc.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Many times when using JQL users want to sort issues in a specific way.  While the Order By operators will allow users to sort all the results in either ascending or descending order, it forces all issues with null values on the order field to be placed at the end or beginning depending on the direction.   It would be very helpful to instead have some kind of hierarchical sorting method to order the first set of issues, and then a second order by to then arrange the other sets of issues that might have null values for the first search.

There is a great example of this problem that might help explain it better.  Let's say you want a single JQL query to return all Epics, and all issues in those Epics, and you want JQL to order these in a manner such as:

{code:borderStyle=solid}
Epic 1
- Task 1
- Task 2
Epic 2
- Task 3
Epic 3
- Task 4 
{code}

There lies a problem in trying to do this.  You can return all these issues in one query such as
type=epic or "Epic Link" is not empty Order by "Epic Link"

This returns those issues, but since Epics themselves don't actually have an epic link value for that field, they are always getting sorted to the bottom.  You could alternatively try to order by "Epic Name", but since the other issues in the query don't actually have an Epic Name value for themselves, you can't order them by that either.  


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if there was either a group by function like sql has, or perhaps some other means to first order the first set of issues (epics), and then order by the second set while ignoring null values in the first order statement.


h3. Why this is a problem
Would be a helpful means to organize information.
fields.summary: When using the Order BY in advanced JQL users should be able to select how to sort null value fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a single-column table using the old issue view, the table will display an extra column when converting it to the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1 - Using the old issue view, add a board to a comment with a single column (Using the wiki style renderer):
 
||*Summary*||
||*Acceptance Criteria*||
|\{color:#00b8d9}Given\{color} text
{color:#00b8d9}When\{color} text
{color:#00b8d9}Then\{color} text |

2 - Convert it to the new issue view
h3. Expected Results

The board should display the same way it does in the Old issue view:
 !image-2019-12-16-12-20-11-338.png|width=187,height=127!
h3. Actual Results

The board displays an extra empty column:

!Screen Shot 2019-12-16 at 13.19.01.png|width=428,height=147!
h3. Workaround

Use the new issue view to create the table.
fields.summary: New issue view does not render single column tables properly

fields.description:
We have recently deprecated TLS1/1.1 support(following article) but at this time we are only supporting TLS1.2 so it would be nice if we can handle TLS 1.3 as well.
* [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Deprecating-TLSv1-and-TLSv1-1-for-Atlassian-Cloud-Products/ba-p/857357]
fields.summary: Add support to TLS 1.3 for Application links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attemping to move issues between projects the screen to choose the project does not show the project names in the project drop down, instead it shows the project ID's. 

 !2016-07-01_1434.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In source project, ensure that 'create issue' does not have any users or groups assigned to it or that you are not a member of those groups
# Choose an issue from the source project to move to another project, click move issue.
# Note on next screen that instead of displaying a list of projects to move to, it displays the project ID.


h3. Expected Results
The project names are displayed in the pick list or an error is thrown to note why you cannot move the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Project ID's show in the list. You can still choose a new issue type but when you click next you receive an error of 'the issue type selected is invalid' even though it is not.

There are no errors thrown in the log files
The following error is thrown in the browser developer console:
{noformat}
Javacript error:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of undefined
batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:948 Uncaught
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The root cause is a permissions issue on the source project.  You should not need create issue permission on the source as you will be moving to a different project.  The pick list for project appears to error out when trying to generate the list because of the lack of permissions.

h3.Workaround


Add relevant users or groups to the 'create issue' permission for the source project you are moving from.
fields.summary: Project ID shows in drop down when moving issue between projects

fields.description: As an Admin I'd like to search for issues commented in certain date and by a certain user. Currently we have the last modified option, which is not restricted to comments.
fields.summary: Search for Comment Date/author through JQL

fields.description:
LDLCR-NA28819-03
Chuyển trạng thái đã bàn giao đối tác để tồn kho khách hàng đúng với thực té trên hệ thống AAW
fields.summary: Chuyển trạng thái đơn hàng ra khỏi hệ thống

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a unauthenticated user hits Jira REST endpoint, with RequestHeader.Accept-Language to be UN M.49 region codes ("es-419" in this case). Instead of returning 401 unauthenticated message, the sever return 500 Internal server error.

Some related tickets: 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33686

[https://denizoguz.atlassian.net/browse/CBSV-332?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use some browser plugin to set RequestHeader.Accept-Language to es-419
 # Go to Jira REST endpoint "/rest/internal/latest/frontendconfig/properties"

On Jdog:

curl https://jdog.jira-dev.com/rest/internal/latest/frontendconfig/properties -v -s -H 'Accept-Language: es-419' -XPOST -o /dev/null

Expected: 401

Actual: 500
h3. Expected Results

Error code 401  !image-2019-12-16-15-38-05-802.png|width=773,height=160!
h3. Actual Results

Page is Broken. 500 Internal server error

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
jira_1                | SEVERE: Mapped exception to response: 500 (Internal Server Error)
jira_1                | javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.text.ParseException: String, es-419, is not a valid language tag
jira_1                | 	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.clientError(HttpHelper.java:265)
jira_1                | 	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.HttpHelper.getAcceptLanguage(HttpHelper.java:222)
jira_1                | 	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.VariantSelector.selectVariant(VariantSelector.java:290)
jira_1                | 	at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.ContainerRequest.selectVariant(ContainerRequest.java:696)
jira_1                | 	at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.AdaptingContainerRequest.selectVariant(AdaptingContainerRequest.java:286)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

 Change the language setting in chrome.
 More details here: 
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/500-internal-server-error-due-to-parseexception-es-419-is-not-a-valid-language-tag-369295958.html]
fields.summary: 500 Internal server error when unauthenticated user hits Jira REST endpoint with language es-419

fields.description:
There is a certain scenario where the user needs to assign himself in the user picker field.

It would be great if we have the functionality to search user himself in user picker filed without having browse users and groups permission from global permission.
fields.summary: Ability to search user himself in user picker field even if he does not have browser users and group permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a project has a default assignee but the default assignee does not have the assignable user permission, when creating a subtask through the new issue view, users would be prompted a generic error message stating that

{quote}
We couldn't create the subtask

Check your connection, then give it another try
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set default assignee on Project Settings details tab
 # Make sure default assignee does not have the assignable user permission
 # Go to any task and make sure you're in the new issue view
 # Create sub task

h3. Expected Results
Just like the old view, error message that states "The default assignee does NOT have ASSIGNABLE permission OR Unassigned issues are turned off."

 !image-2019-12-16-12-06-29-518.png|width=350! 

h3. Actual Results
Generic error message is prompted

 !image-2019-12-16-12-07-27-827.png|width=350! 

h3. Workaround
Create sub task in the old view to see the error message or run the developer console to see the error. The error message is visible in Console log:

{code}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"assignee":"The default assignee does NOT have ASSIGNABLE permission OR Unassigned issues are turned off."}}
{code}
fields.summary: Generic error message in the new view when creating a sub task

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Date/Time picker custom field shows incorrect date/time

h3. Steps to Reproduce (happens to specific users)
# Enter date for the date-time custom field.

h3. Expected Results
* The Date/Time picker custom field shows the date/time it was first set to.

h3. Actual Results
* The Date/Time picker custom field date/time value changes.

h3. Workaround
* Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date/Time picker custom field shows incorrect date/time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user added an email address on a Text Field (single line), the email address is treated as a hyperlink due to the 'dot+characters' from the domain, i.e foo@acme.com or foo@acme.acme

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field with the Text Field (Single Line) type
# Enter email address on the field

h3. Expected Results
Email is rendered as an email (mailto), rather than a link

h3. Actual Results
Email is rendered as a link so when clicking on it would redirect users to another page

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Email address is rendered as a link on a text field (single line)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new issue view does not respect the order in which the options are shown in a custom field of type Select List (cascading).

Order configured:


 !options_order_configured.png|width=400,height=402!

Order shown in new issue view:


 !incorrect_order_in_new_view.png|width=639,height=600!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Select List (cascading)
 # Configure some options and sort them in any order
 # Add the field to an issue screen.
 # Click the custom field in the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

The options will show in the order that is configured
h3. Actual Results

The options are shown in a different order than the one that is configured
h3. Workaround

Using the old issue view will show the options in the order that is configured.
fields.summary: Options in custom fields of type Select List (cascading) are not showing in the configured order in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an issue using the *Create issue* screen it's not possible to use the _markdown_ formatting, because after the issue is created the text will not render correctly. The reason for this is that the *Create issue* screen still uses the wiki _markup_ formatting.

h3. Suggestion
Apply the _markdown_ for the *Create issue* screen.
fields.summary: Add support to the markdown formatting on the create issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Field values in edit mode are cached when browser is closed.  

If another user make changes on the same field from another machine or browser, their saved changes can be accidentally overwritten. 

Since the cache value do not update based on the existing field value, saving the changes  then will overwrite changes from other users working on the same field.

This only affects new JIRA issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

!bandicam 2019-12-13 17-37-55-105.mp4|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Not sure what the expected result should be but caching should incorporate the latest value of the field.

h3. Actual Results

Field shows the cached changes . If a user accidentally safe the cached changes, it will overwrite contributions from other users.

h3. Workaround

No workaround for now.
fields.summary: Field value caching in new JIRA issue view can potentially overwrite user changes

fields.description: Enable settings to edit the Log Work Screens so Admins are able to hide or show fields on their needs.
fields.summary: Log Work screen editable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when issue imported from JSON/CSV , the channel are set to "Unknown" for JIRA Service Desk issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the channel to "Import"

h3. Why this is important
 This is for user awareness of how the issue created.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Issue created via JSON/CSV import , "Request Channel Type" will set as "Import"

fields.description:
Currently, there are two icons and 3 states of restrictions. 

 

Please enhance the icon for "editing restricted" to be locked and grey to indicate that there are restrictions, but not as restricted as "locked and red". This would make is easier to see that the restrictions are correct than it is today.

This will leave you with 3 states and 3 icons.

  !image-2019-12-12-12-39-23-978.png!
fields.summary: Change restrictions icon

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the previous status has this property, {{jira.permission.assign.group = group1}}, and the next status has this property, {{jira.permission.assign.group = group2}}, then during transition, users from "group2" are not able to set the value for "Assignee" field. This is because it is still following the property from the previous status.

h3. Proposed Solution
The ability, either default or toggle-able, to use the permissions from the target status instead of the source status during a transition.

Or, while in transition, use properties set in transition instead of status.
fields.summary: When transitioning between statuses, the transition will use properties from the source status, not the destination status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The old issue view lets you add an inline image in wiki markup to a non-existent attachment. The attachment will be displayed correctly if it is uploaded later. In the new issue view the attachment will not display correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an inline image in the Description field of an issue on the old issue view, using wiki markup such as {noformat}!image.png!{noformat} Make sure the image file is not currently attached to the issue. The description will be rendered as "Unable to render embedded object: File (image.png) not found".

# Attach the missing image file to the issue and refresh the old issue view. The inline image should be displayed correctly. 

# Switch to the new issue view. The attachment will not display correctly:
 !Attachment.png|thumbnail! 

This is a problem because when you create an issue using the REST API, you cannot pass attachments to the POST /rest/api/2/issue endpoint, so you first pass the Description as a wiki-markup string, and only after can you add the related attachments. Which means inline attachments will show just fine on the newly created issue under the old issue view, but not under the new issue view.
Same thing of course if you set the Description field using the PUT API. You'd need to first make sure to copy all the required attachments, which is not intuitive.

h3. Expected Results

The attachment displays in the new issue view after the file is uploaded

h3. Actual Results

The attachment fails to display.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachment doesn't display in new issue view when uploaded after being added inline with Wiki markup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markup and Markdown table render wrongly during issue creation. The table renders three columns when only two columns were created.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click create issue
# Enter the table patterns below in description{code}| Tables        | Are           |
| --- |---|
| col 3 is      | right-aligned |
| col 2 is      | centered      |
| zebra stripes | are neat      |


||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Col A1|Col A2|{code}
# Click created issue
# View issue

Short video description of the problem:  [^bandicam 2019-12-12 13-48-42-125.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
A two-column table is rendered

h3. Actual Results
A three-column table is rendered instead.

h3. Workaround
Edit the field and delete the unwanted column.
fields.summary: Markup and Markdown table render wrongly during issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing the *bulk change* and choosing the *move* issues operation (for when you want to change project or issue type). The procedure is likely to timeout *in the validation stage* if:

* You're moving sub-tasks
* The instance has a lot of custom fields (on my test the instance had around 500 custom fields).
* If there are too many parent issues from the sub-tasks filtered (Jira does 1 validation for each parent from sub-tasks in the bulk) - I tested with 30 different parents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a lot of custom fields
# Create a lot of parent issues and sub-tasks for each
# Attempt to perform a *Bulk Change* using the *Move* option

h3. Expected Results
Jira should be able to perform a bulk with 1000 issues

h3. Actual Results
Even with very few issues, the procedure times out in one of the validation stages.

h3. Workaround
Use bulk edit when possible or, reduce the bulk change scope until it works.

h3. Notes
I recorded a video showing this https://share.getcloudapp.com/GGuA0EB5

We can see through the network tab that  *GET /secure/views/bulkedit/BulkMigrateSetFields!default.jspa* exceeds the 60s  threshold, ending up in a timeout.
fields.summary: Bulk Move with sub-tasks can timeout on validations

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I would like to see the component description while selecting a new value for the component field.
I would also like to see the component description while browsing a Jira issue.
fields.summary: Add the component description on Jira's issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a field is set to 'Required' in the *Field Configuration*, it will always be prompted in any screen in any issue that uses this Field Configuration and does not have any value for the field. Even if the field is not set in any screen in JIRA.

h3. Propose solution:

JIRA cleans up these configurations. If a field is not present in any screens, JIRA will automatically make the field optional. 

JIRA will disregard the 'Required' setting of the *Field Configuration* if the field is not present on the screen. This way, even though the field is required for the screens it is in, JIRA will not prompt a value for the field when it is not possible to add one.

h3. Workaround

For making this field required without making it globally mandatory, you can use a [Condition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-conditions] or [Validator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/advanced-workflow-configuration-776636620.html#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-validators] in the Workflow which adds this requirement check when attempting to transition Issues.
fields.summary: Better Behavior for Required Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, it's not possible to get the options for a custom field without having Jira Administer permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Use the endpoint *Get options for field* without having Jira Administer permission.

h3. Expected Results
Users without Jira Administer permission can see the results.

h3. Actual Results
Only users with Jira Administer permission can see the results.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Restore "GET /rest/api/3/customField/{fieldId}/option" for jira users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having copy value post-function from a field without any value to *Summary* field in *Create* transition will cause Jira mail notification to fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit workflow *Create* transition.
 # Add "Copy Value From Other Field" post-function.
# Set source to *Epic Name* and destination to *Summary*.
# Create an issue in the project.

h3. Expected Results

Issue created email notification is received without any issue.

h3. Actual Results

No email for the issue created.

Error thrown in Jira log about Summary being NULL
{noformat}
Response: '400', 'Bad Request', '{"code":400,"message":"Schema 'jira/jira_issue_schema_v2.json' failed validation.","errors":[{"code":"SCHEMA_VALIDATION_FAILED","message":"Schema 'jira/jira_issue_schema_v2.json' failed validation."}],"processingErrors":[{"level":"error","schema":{"loadingURI":"#","pointer":"/definitions/issue/properties/fields/properties/summary"},"instance":{"pointer":"/issue/fields/summary"},"domain":"validation","keyword":"type","message":"instance type (null) does not match any allowed primitive type (allowed: [\"string\"])","found":"null","expected":["string"]},
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Issue notification failed due to copy value post-function for SUMMARY field in Create transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the Jira Cloud app for Mac, you have the assignee quick filter available on the Board view but on the Backlog view, you have no quick filter options.

 !_JST-535624__I_ve_just_started_using_the_Jira_app_for_Mac_and_a…_-_Atlassian_Support_System.png|thumbnail!  !_JST-535624__I_ve_just_started_using_the_Jira_app_for_Mac_and_a…_-_Atlassian_Support_System_bzcklog.png|thumbnail! 

Not having this option creates filer content to your Backlog that may not be relevant to your work.

This is also applicable to the Jira mobile app on Android/iOS.

h3. Proposed solution

Include quick filters in the Backlog view so users can get the view most relevant to their work.
fields.summary: Add assignee quick filter to Backlog in Jira Cloud app for Mac

fields.description:
Currently, when an issue is transitioned due to a trigger in the workflow that is associated with an action in Bitbucket, the new issue view history tab doesn't provide additional information about the origin of this transition. When this happens, Jira registers as:
* Jira automatically changed the *Status*.

Whereas in the old issue view, we see more information, for example:
* Automated transition triggered when [event].

This suggestion is to allow users to have more information available to them.
fields.summary: Allow the new issue view history tab to show the same information associated with a transition triggered by Bitbucket as the old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In some supported browsers, across OS platforms, the left side project navigation menu in Jira Cloud can have a tendency to clip some text along the bottom.  This causes the text to look bad, and it makes it harder to read correctly.  It might be related to the specific font being used in different environments (Mac OS, vs Windows).



h3. Steps to Reproduce
While this can be more visible when using a browsers zoom function, it is not exclusively seen when changing zoom.  It can be see in standard resolutions, at default zoom.

It can be seen in supported browsers such as latest Chrome and Firefox.  Screenshots are from a Google Chrome 78.0.3904.108 (Official Build) (64-bit) Win10 Home.  However even when in Mac OS with Chrome/Firefox this too can still be seen.



h3. Expected Results
Sidebar links should display the complete letters/words.

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the bottom of letters are getting clipped:

 !fontclipped1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
You can sometimes work around this by adjust zoom in or out a level, but this workaround is not desirable and should not be relied upon.
fields.summary: Text in the sidebar is sometimes being clipped from below in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even though a user has been granted "Delete own worklogs" permission, the option to delete their own worklog is not seen in New Issue View. However, it can be done via Old Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log your work on an issue
 # Grant yourself "Delete Own Worklogs" permission 
 # Go back to the issue's worklog activity and attempt to delete the work using New issue view
 # You won't be able to see the "Delete" feature
 # Switch to Old issue view to verify if you can delete the worklog

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to see the "delete" feature on their own worklog in both New Issue view and Old Issue View if they are granted "Delete Own Worklogs" permission.
h3. Actual Results

"Delete" feature can't be seen on own worklog in New Issue view but can be seen in Old Issue View
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Unable to delete own worklog in New Issue View
